description.narrative: By 2016, the treatment of childhood diseases (malaria, pneumonia, diarrhea) is effective both at community level and in health facilities in the targeted prefectures.(2012-2014) By 2016, the treatment of childhood diseases (malaria, pneumonia, diarrhea) and multi-micronutrient supplementation are effective both at community level and in health facilities in the 13 targeted prefectures.

sector.narrative: IMNCI / Integrated Community Case Management (iCCM) - Community
Immunization supply chain, including cold chain

title.narrative: Central African Republic United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Programmes in Central African Republic
Central African Republic Country Programme Document 2018-2021
Programme Cooperation Agreement Central African Republic
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Central African Republic 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Central African Republic Country Office 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, the treatment of childhood diseases (malaria, pneumonia, diarrhea) is effective both at community level and in health facilities in the targeted prefectures.(2012-2014) By 2016, the treatment of childhood diseases (malaria, pneumonia, diarrhea) and multi-micronutrient supplementation are effective both at community level and in health facilities in the 13 targeted prefectures.

description.narrative: 10405 sick children were treated in iCCM sites and 1000 severe cases referred. iCCM capacity building included 6 national level trainers and two dozen staff from 5 NGOs contracted to support expansion. In health facility, 102000 of the 196,300 sick children treated were managed by staff with improved competencies | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/01/2018

title.narrative: % of children (boys and girls) under 5 years with diarrheoa, malaria, pneumonia and malnutrition treated appropriately at the community and health facility levels

actual.value: 2015:No progress. iCCM strategic plan has just been elaborated. Interventions will start in 6 selected prefecture in 2016. The responsible staff is being recruited.
